posts.cooked:
Lets start tracking features that differ across Signal versions.

Please note that this is not a list of all existing features or feature requests! If you want the list of all feature requests, go ahead to this topic. Only include a feature below if it:

  1. has already been implemented on at least one platform and
  2. it is still missing on at least one other platform.

Link to existing feature requests if possible.

Meanings of statuses

Status Meaning
Feature available / implemented
Feature partially implemented / incomplete
Feature unavailable / not implemented
Same as , but unlikely to ever be implemented
Status unknown or unclear. You can help by testing if this feature is available on the platform in question and editing this wiki
N/A Not applicable: see footnote for more information
iOS (iPad) status matches that of iOS (iPhone)

Features

Feature Android iOS (iPhone) iOS (iPad) Desktop
Background audio playback
Backups FR 5 FR
Broadcast Media
Calls: display audio levels during call 14
Calls: display duration during call 15
Calls: show in system call log / recents N/A10 N/A10
Clear all chats
Connectivity: Censorship circumvention FR
Connectivity: Signal Proxy support FR
Chat wallpapers
Choose app icon
Create/manage Signal PIN
Custom notification sounds FR
Custom ringtones FR
Database encryption key stored encrypted 9
Debug log: Disabling possible FR
Debug log: Exporting/saving before submission FR 4 FR
Debug log: Viewing before submission 12
Delete alerts (e.g. “You set the disappearing message time to 1 hour.”) 3 FR
Direct device-to-device data transfer
Dismiss contact permission request banner FR N/A6
Distributed in an app store FRs: Apple, Microsoft
GIPHY integration (GIF search and sending) FR
Image editor: Add stickers to outgoing photos
Image editor: Available when changing profile/group photo FR
Image editor: Blur tools
In-Car-Apps (Android Auto / Apple CarPlay) 17 18 FR N/A N/A
Media de-duplication FR
Message input toolbar: search for emoji e.g. :tada
Message Trimming FR FR
Multi-select/Select-all media (to export) 1 FR FR
Multi-select/Select-all media (to delete) 1 FR
Multi-select chats FR
Multi-select messages (to copy) 11
Non-Latin Initials in profile icon FR
Notification that someone quoted your message FR FR
Playback speed controls: video FR FR
Register as linked device 7 FR 7 FR
Register as primary device 2 FR
Release notes chat
Reproducible builds FR
Scheduled Messages
Screen locking with PIN, passphrase, fingerprint, face, etc. FR
Screen sharing in a call8 FR FR
Send button when the message is empty but has an attachment FR
Send files with any extension (including .apk) FR
Send (small) video in original quality FR
Send view-once media FR
Share a location
Stories: read16 receipts: process from linked devices FR
Stories: read16 receipts: send to linked devices FR
Sticker packs: create / upload
Sticker packs: reorder 13 FR FR
Storage space management FR
Trim / cut a video before sending it
View files without exporting first FR
View replies to (reply thread of) a message FR
Welcome screen shows some contacts

Footnotes

# Footnote
β Currently in beta. How do I join Signal’s beta?
1 Multi-select is available in “All Media” for a chat, but “Select All” is not available.
2 iPads can indeed also be used as primary.
3 It’s possible to delete these using the keyboard shortcut for deletion, but not via the UI.
4 You can export it if uploading fails (see this post).
5 There’s currently no menu option to export a backup, but it is possible to copy the contents of the folder where Signal Desktop stores its data. See this wiki for more information.
6 Signal Desktop doesn’t ask for contact permissions.
7 Development in progress? No ETA, stay tuned.
8 Note: while Signal doesn’t support sharing the screen on all platforms, it’s possible to view a shared screen on any platform.
9 Encryption keys are stored encrypted in Android versions 6.0 (Marshmallow, API 23) and newer.
10 There is no such thing as a system call log on an iPad or on desktop.
11 You can select text as usual on a desktop, but selecting across multiple messages may select extra text (such as names of users), which may be undesired.
12 In Signal Desktop itself, you can only view a few lines at the beginning of the log.
13 It may be not obvious that sticker packs can be reordered in Signal Android, see this topic.
14 Only displays audio levels for group calls.
15 Doesn’t appear to show duration for group calls.
16 See the FR for more details on what read receipts mean for stories, as well as details regarding support for the read receipt syncing on different platforms.https://community.signalusers.org/t/choose-app-icon/16460
17 Only responding to new Messages using GA. No Calls. See FR and FR
18 Incoming Calls work via the present CallKit integration. Call back works via the CarPlay Phone App.

posts.cooked:
newuser:

So the iOS app is looking at whether its run on iphone/ipad and then showing different registration screens?

Yeah, pretty much; but actually it's the same screen.
Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 3.0 release

While the copy is there for this, this feature isn’t quite ready for prime time yet. Currently only iPads can be used as a secondary device. We’re definitely thinking about these other use cases though and we may expand it to more devices in the future.

Signal-iOS/Signal/src/ViewControllers/Registration/OnboardingController.swift at 9f3e6e0c53be618a79c55122705e768a981d3fc4 · signalapp/Signal-iOS · GitHub

Signal-iOS/Signal/src/ViewControllers/Registration/OnboardingSplashViewController.swift at 9f3e6e0c53be618a79c55122705e768a981d3fc4 · signalapp/Signal-iOS · GitHub

In fact, on anything other than iPads, the “switch onboarding mode” button is simply hidden:

Signal-iOS/Signal/src/ViewControllers/Registration/OnboardingSplashViewController.swift at 9f3e6e0c53be618a79c55122705e768a981d3fc4 · signalapp/Signal-iOS · GitHub

Until this feature flag is enabled:

Signal-iOS/SignalServiceKit/src/Util/FeatureFlags.swift at b7277aae7b7924d0237e450e225961c6601652c2 · signalapp/Signal-iOS · GitHub

posts.cooked: I think the copy-paste method is more like a partial workaround than an actual backup feature. The feature request here is asking for the ability to “export backups from Signal Desktop in the same way you can export them from Signal for Android,” with the expectation that these backup files will be compatible with Signal Android.

link_counts.title: Allow exporting a backup from Signal Desktop · Issue #522 · signalapp/Signal-Desktop · GitHub

posts.cooked: I have now edited that entry to indicate that the feature is “partially implemented” with the footnote: “There’s currently no menu option to export a backup, but it is possible to copy the contents of the folder where Signal Desktop stores its data.”

klajsdgasjg:

I have no iPad to test. Can someone verify?

It is implement, just as on iOS in general.

newuser:

Custom ringtones & notification sounds

What do you guys mean with “custom ringtones and notification sounds” not available on linked iPads? You may choose custom notification sounds per contact on the linked iPad, too. But afaik you can only choose from a bunch of Apple’s sounds, not a “custom custom” one.

klajsdgasjg:

Save message drafts

What is the “save message drafts” feature? If you type a message and don’t send it, it still is in the “New message” field after leaving the conversation or closing/reopening Signal. So imo this is partially implement because I’m missing some “Draft: LORE IPSUM” message in the message preview section to see you already began typing a message.

klajsdgasjg:

Censorship circumvention

I never used it, but as I can activate “Censorship circumvention” in Signal settings on iPhone and linked iPad I’d say this is already implemented.

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked:
mihahn:

afaik you can only choose from a bunch of Apple’s sounds

Do note that it’s Signal’s pre-chosen bunch of Apple’s sounds. It neither allows you to pick any ringtone that comes with your iOS version, nor allows to use iTunes Store music (while system ringtone does).

posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked: Every time I come check this list to see if something has been added already, I find out it has been added. This list is great, very complete and insightful.

Is there no space in the existing OP-Wiki to stick in that link? I think having that mentioned either as a section below the Footnotes, or wherever is feasible in the intro text, would be helpful for folks that do enjoy the Wiki-experience of digging around. (-:

Can anyone check/compare/add geo location share handling ability? (eg.
28.22449° N, 17.17250° E)
Signal Android is’t supporting such links.

Does any other other app support it?
But i noticed i adressed the wrong wiki

@klajsdgasjg The feature is definitely available on Desktop, I removed that row.

But note that I think archived conversations are not synced between devices at this moment, which is also stated as “preferable” in the FR.

link_counts.title: Conversation archival (as on Android)

posts.cooked:
Something to potentially add – blocking contacts, and viewing the list of blocked contacts.

I could be missing something and can’t fully verify at the moment, but from a quick check, it appears that the Desktop app does not have an option to block (or unblock) a contact, nor a way to view which contacts are blocked.

newuser:

iOS Call Integration

That setting may be related to the iOS app’s integration with CallKit:

CallKit is an iOS 10 feature that brings apps like Signal to the same level as the native iOS calling experience. It makes Signal calls answerable with one touch directly from the lock screen, allows initiating Signal calls through the native contacts app, and displays Signal calls in the system’s “recent calls” list.

I think it could be left out of this list because it’s not applicable to Android or desktop. Unless there is a similar call integration feature on Android that isn’t supported yet?

link_counts.title: Signal >> Blog >> Video calls for Signal out of beta

posts.cooked: You could integrate your call logs with the system one on android as well. But no app really does this so it’s not as common and not really needed…
